page.title: 07Employment
page.content: As is to be expected in a rural community many of the people work on the land. Most of the farms have belonged to one family for several generations and are currently worked by father and son. casual labour, mostly women, is employed for potato picking and sorting. Several people conduct one man businesses such as joinery, secondhand car sales and repair, building, caravan hire/tow bar fitting, pighouse building designing and fishing reel manufacture. There is an unusually high number of school teachers both men and women, who teach at junior and senior levels. We have a pilot and a doctor both at RAF Linton-on-Ouse. Other occupations are barrister, 2 research workers, company directors, engineer, journalist with Radio York, Sales representatives, diplomat, civil
